Title: CDS links military saboteurs to Benue massacre ahead of Tinubu’s visit
Summary: The Chief of Defence Staff, General Christopher Musa, yesterday alleged the presence of saboteurs in the Yelwata massacre in Benue State that claimed over 200 lives .

Title: Damagum denies defection plans as Tinubu’s ex-aide vows to plot his 2027 defeat
Summary: Acting National Chairman of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Ambassador Ilyas Umar Damagum denies defection plans . PDP's acting National Chairman, Ambassador Iyas U. Umar Dharagum, says he has no intention of defecting to the ruling party .

Title: Sokoto to negotiate with repentant bandits to end insecurity
Summary: Sokoto to negotiate with repentant bandits to end insecurity . Special Adviser on Security Matters to the Sokoto State Governor, Col. Ahmed Usman (rtd), has reiterated the state government’s commitment to lasting peace and security .

Title: That despicable teacher-battering incident in Ondo State
Summary: Stakeholders in education and indeed every well-meaning Nigerian should roundly condemn the recent incident in Ondo State . The vice principal of a private secondary school was beaten up by an organised mob .

Title: Enoh, MAN, others finalise new national industrial policy
Summary: Nigeria’s path to industrial revolution has gained momentum with a national industrial policy . The policy is a departure from historically fragmented draft documents – at the final stage .

Title: SEC to co-create framework for stablecoins regulations — DG
Summary: SEC is engaging with developers to co-create a framework for regulation of stablecoins . The Director General, Securities and Exchange Commission, Dr Emomotimi Agama, made the disclosure in a keynote speech at the 2025 Decentralised Finance in Lagos .

Title: FG issues N50 bn Green Bond
Summary: The Debt Management Office (DMO) has put on offer a N50 billion Green Bond, on behalf of the Federal Government . The proceeds would be used to fund several climate-friendly projects .

Title: Digitisation across sectors key to unlocking Nigeria’s AI future — Microsoft, PwC, LBS
Summary: Nigeria must prioritise digitisation across sectors, generating a comprehensive dataset to drive innovation . This is one of the key findings from Microsoft’s new white paper, “AI in Nigeria” The report was commissioned by Microsoft and conducted by PwC and Lagos Business School (LBS)

Title: Benue killings: LP demands probe, military deployment
Summary: The Labour Party has condemned the mass killings in Benue State and called for an urgent deployment of security forces to vulnerable communities . The party’s National Caretaker Committee, led by Senator Nenadi Usman, demanded a full-scale investigation and immediate prosecution of the perpetrators, regardless of their affiliations or social status . Summary: The Pension Transitional Arrangement Directorate, an agency of the Federal Government, has disbursed N8.6bn as arrears of the N32,000 pension increment approved by President Bola Tinubu in 2024 . The latest instalment covers all 148,625 eligible pensioners under the Defined Benefit Scheme

Title: IG, speakers clash as state police debate intensifies
Summary: The police boss reiterated his earlier position that what the Nigeria Police Force needed to tackle the security challenges in the country was adequate funding . Chairman of the Conference of Speakers of State Houses of Assembly, Debo Ogundoyin, called for a multi-layered policing model as obtained in other parts of the country .

Title: Power failures spark push for renewable energy
Summary: The push for renewable energy solutions has gained significant traction in recent years, especially in rural areas where access to reliable electricity remains challenging . The power grid, which has experienced two major disturbances this year, seven collapses in 2024, and 140 series of grid collapses since its privatisation in 2013, is facing mounting challenges .

Title: Tight security as Lagos APC unveils LG candidates
Summary: The campaign flag-off will be held at the party’s headquarters in Ogba, following weeks of internal wrangling over the May 10 primary . The party leadership, in June, inaugurated a reconciliation committee to resolve all conflicts and dissatisfaction in the aftermath of the primary .
